page.title: 11 FELINDRE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall was built in 1950. It was built because the people wanted a place where they could hold meetings dances,whist drives and concerts. It was built by Garth Garages in Knighton and it cost Â£1,560. The money was raised by the people in the community. The hall is run by the village hall committee. Every year they hold a show and sports to raise money to clean the hall and repair it. In 1983 the hall was renovated. The improvements cost Â£15,342. The hall is a vital amenity for the community. It is used by the Young Farmers'Club and the Women's Institute. They hold regular meetings there. There are concerts in the winter months. On November 5th a bonfire is built in the field outside the hall and there is a firework display. Afterwards refreshments are served in the hall with a disco.
